meanings.definition: To break into pieces suddenly or violently.
meanings.sent1: The glass shatters when it falls on the floor.
meanings.sent2: The mirror shatters into tiny fragments when it hits the ground.
meanings.sent3: The vase shatters into a million pieces, making a mess.
meanings.sent4: Her heart shatters like glass when she hears the bad news.
meanings.sent5: The loud noise of the window shattering startles everyone in the room.

meanings.definition: To damage or destroy something completely.
meanings.sent1: The earthquake shatters buildings and roads.
meanings.sent2: The storm shatters the fragile roof of the old house.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy giant accidentally shatters the delicate teacup.
meanings.sent4: The loud music shatters the peaceful atmosphere of the library.
meanings.sent5: The loud explosion shatters the silence of the night.

meanings.definition: To cause great emotional distress or shock.
meanings.sent1: The heartbreaking news shatters her world.
meanings.sent2: The sudden loss of a loved one shatters our hearts.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's joke shatters the tension in the room.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected plot twist shatters our expectations.
meanings.sent5: The terrifying scream shatters the calm of the night.
